@eiregirl58 @thejournal_ie I guess this is where the reused plastic bottles come in.
@parrylel 😂 Oh dear, is this the smoker's bench?
@HoustonMargaret @sqlblues @ShippersUnbound Did he? Maybe I only saw the censored wording. Were there expletives?
@ohoncharuk @WilliamSitwell Needs sculptures and bookshops, but yes.
@foghornjambo @ohoncharuk @MrMalky Edinburgh's the exception because it's in 3D - all those levels 🙂
@AnneMurray3 @ohoncharuk @MurrayData Not to my knowledge. The city's main river is always a good landmark... until you visit Amsterdam. Amsterdam confused me.
@FourAngledMusic @Oireachtas_RX Nic, nach ea? I'm nobody's grandson 😉 Everyone forgets that the Normans were Viking settlers. Adaptable.

@PaulCar72934736 @desmondotoole @SocdemsDMW @SocDems That's one way to vote, based on a former, joint leader... Happy to note that the politicians I originally voted for still have integrity, and plenty of votes.
@FourAngledMusic @Oireachtas_RX Ah, there's bound to be Norman/Viking genes in there too, fadó, fadó.
@tvcritics The food, though. Anyway, this is why shopping should be acknowledged as an Olympic sport.
@FourAngledMusic @Oireachtas_RX Fair enough. Reminds me of the Maria VonTrapp quote; "I'm not poor. I just don't have any money." 😔

@IanRSlack2 @PropertySpot @ABridgen Maybe that's an idea worth kicking around. Designate a place next to Coventry, called Brexshire; exclusively for blue passport holders? Currency unit: 50p. (In blue steel, naturally.)
@TiernanDouieb @daithi84 @Bliadhnaichean @BBCPolitics @andrewismaxwell People watch it online, though.

RT @sufitzy: The headline, genius ⭐️⭐️ #Aras18 #michaeldhiggins #keepthepoet https://t.co/lUQB8t1XuI
@FlynnFlann92 @daraobriain Probably 🤔 You should get value for your Irish passports.

@threedisgraces @daraobriain An ordinary law, yes. Not if it is written into our Constitution as national policy. I wonder how this will work with Irish books printed in Britain, BTW? Will it be 'Down with this sort of thing?'
@rider45 @daraobriain Weirdly, the more referenda you vote in, the shorter the walk to the polling station 😊
@hiomhair @NursepollyRgn To cap it all, most television screens were black & white.

@sylviabowe @NursepollyRgn The good old sarcoptic mange mite! Much snappier than mere dinosaur names.
I was fifteen before I read James Herriot and found out what they even were.

@Annacreegan @NursepollyRgn As a child, I thought that was hooves. Ads for worm drenches applied with petrol pumps? - I could be mistaken there. Cures for liver flukes and mange, all while you were having your dinner. We had strong stomachs in those days!
